translation.en: [male presenter] Next, we induct one of the most pivotal players in Texas A&M history.
translation.ko: 이제 텍사스 A&M 사상 가장 중요한 선수를 소개합니다

translation.en: -[commentators] -Oh, my gracious.
-Yep. -How about that?
[excitedly] A&M did it. They just did it.
[presenter] …won a Heisman Trophy.
-[commentators] -Here comes Johnny Football.
The Heisman Trophy, for the first time, has gone to a freshman quarterback.
He is must-watch TV.
[presenter] He is a living legend, Johnny Manziel.
[Johnny] Let me paint a little picture for you of how I'm able to sit here today
translation.ko: 제가 어떻게 29살에 이 무대에 설 수 있었는지

translation.en: and be on this stage at 29 years old.
When I stepped on campus in 2011, it didn't look like this.
translation.ko: 2011년에 처음 여기 왔을 땐 이렇지 않았어요

translation.en: [crowd] Johnny Football!
[commentator] He's taken on Rolling Stones, Beatles status.
This stadium didn't look like this…
…we didn't have the buzz that we have today.
[man] …brought A&M back to national prominence.
[commentator] In the preseason, hardly anyone knew who Johnny Manziel was.
translation.ko: 프리시즌에는 조니 맨젤이 누군지 거의 아무도 몰랐어요

translation.en: It'd be very easy to turn your back on some of the things I was doing in my life,
translation.ko: 제 과거 행적 때문에 저를 외면하기가 쉬울 거예요

translation.en: and I live with a lot of regret.
[woman] New trouble for Johnny Manziel.
-[man] …under investigation for assault. -Manziel has gone into rehab.
translation.ko: - 폭행 혐의로 조사 중입니다 - 맨젤이 재활원에 입원했습니다

translation.en: The family fears he is spiraling out of control.
translation.ko: 가족은 맨젤의 상태 악화를 우려하고 있습니다

translation.en: [Johnny] But at the same time, I've lived with a lot of pride.
I am beyond thankful for each and every Aggie in this room
translation.ko: 여기 계신 팬분들께 이루 말할 수 없이 감사합니다

translation.en: that's supported me through the good,
through the bad,
and through times that really just didn't even make sense for me.
translation.ko: 그리고 제가 갈피를 못 잡고 헤매고 있을 때도요

translation.en: From the bottom of my heart, I wanna say thank you very much.
translation.ko: 정말 온 마음을 다해 감사하다는 말씀을 드립니다

translation.en: Thanks and Gig 'em.
[man] Ooh, I loved it when you were here.
Through all the shenanigans, I still loved it.
translation.ko: 아무리 허튼 짓을 했어도 난 자네를 사랑했지

translation.en: Thank you very much.
-What's up? -[boy] You're why I love A&M.
[Johnny] Thank you, bro.
-What are you doing these days? -Living in Scottsdale, enjoying life.
translation.ko: - 요즘 뭐 해요? - 스코츠데일에서 인생을 즐기죠

translation.en: You got your private airplane yet?
Not yet. I'm working on it.
-We gotta do the money sign. -I got you.
-Thank you. -Good to see you, guys.
-Thanks for everything. -Good to see you.
-[man] Good to see you. -Good to see you.
How are you? Thank you, bro. Good to see you guys.
Good to see you. I appreciate it.
-[indistinct chatter, laughter] -[soft music playing] [man] Oh, what the fuck?
You do not change bats in the middle of the series, dawg.
translation.ko: 시리즈 중간에 배트를 바꾸면 안 되지

translation.en: [Johnny] There is who you are as a football player,
and then, there is who you are as a human being,
and the two, for me, were just really different.
translation.ko: 제 경우에 그 둘은 그냥 정말 달랐어요

translation.en: I almost felt like I had an alter ego.
I wanted to be Johnny Football. Johnny Football never had a bad time.
translation.ko: 전 조니 풋볼이 되고 싶었어요 조니 풋볼은 나쁠 때가 없었죠

translation.en: So, when people asked me, "Do you like the nickname Johnny Football?"
I fucking loved it.
I thought it was awesome.
JFF, Johnny Fucking Football. What's up?
-[Johnny panting heavily] -[owl hooting]
-[crowd cheering] -[referee blowing whistle]
[Johnny] Football is everything in Texas.
You know, If you don't play football, you're either too big of a pussy to play,
translation.ko: 풋볼을 안 하면 겁쟁이라 못 하는 거거나

translation.en: or you're just not any good.
[Johnny] Town closes down when it's Friday night and there's game.
translation.ko: 금요일 밤에 경기가 있으면 모든 게 멈춰버려요

translation.en: The football team was the lifeline.
[presenter] Johnny Football!
First time I met Johnny was in middle school.
We both loved video games, um, we both loved football,
translation.ko: 둘 다 비디오 게임을 좋아하고 풋볼을 좋아했죠

translation.en: we both loved girls,
so we had all the most important things in life in common.
translation.ko: "네이트 피치 - 친구" 그러니 인생에서 가장 중요한 공통점이 있었죠

translation.en: The Johnny I know is a kid
who wanted to be the very best football player you could possibly be
translation.ko: 최고의 풋볼 선수가 되고 싶어 하는 아이요

translation.en: and, after that, go drink some beers out on a ranch,
drive a 20-year-old truck over to do it.
[Johnny] Called him Uncle Nate. He was like my right-hand man.
translation.ko: 네이트 삼촌이라고 불렀어요 제 오른팔 같았죠

translation.en: We were just good old country boys.
If you've seen Friday Night Lights, you've seen anything like that…
-Clear eyes, full hearts… -Can't lose!
translation.ko: - 맑은 눈과 진심 - 질 순 없다!

translation.en: …that's what Kerrville was.
The intensity, all of it. The, you know, hard-ass dads.
Johnny was born on my birthday.
♪ Happy birthday, dear Jonathan… ♪
[Paul] We have the same mannerisms, the same birthdays. He's me made over, pretty much.
translation.ko: 우리는 하는 짓도 생일도 같아요 저를 빼다 박았죠

translation.en: [woman] There he is.
Paul!
Discipline in our family pretty much came from me.
translation.ko: 우리 집안의 훈육은 주로 제가 맡았어요

translation.en: You just teach 'em to do the right thing all the time.
translation.ko: 그냥 늘 옳은 일을 하라고 가르치는 거죠

translation.en: We truly are each other's best friends.
translation.ko: 우린 서로 제일 친한 친구예요 "메리 말레첵 - 여동생"

translation.en: End of my 4th-grade year, we moved to Kerrville,
and it was a totally different pace of life for us.
[Nate] Tivy High School was very much a military-style football program,
translation.ko: "타이비 고등학교" 타이비 고등학교 풋볼팀은 거의 군대식 프로그램이었어요

translation.en: and all of your best friends are doing it right next to you,
so you're not gonna be the asshole that stands out. Just fall in line.
translation.ko: 혼자 튀는 짓거리는 못 해요 하란 대로 해야죠

translation.en: My dad wanted me to be in that program because of how strict they ran it.
translation.ko: 엄격한 프로그램 때문에 아빠가 절 거기 넣으셨어요

translation.en: Your first period of the day, 7 a.m., is football.
Different weight room stations every single day. Six stations, six coaches,
and then after school, you practice again, so we had a double dose every single day.
translation.ko: 방과 후에 또 훈련하니까 매일 두 탕씩 뛰는 거죠

translation.en: The Kerrville way, the Tivy way,
the "Tivy fight never dies," that whole mantra that we had
translation.ko: 저희에겐 거의 주문과도 같던 '타이비 싸움은 죽지 않는다'는

translation.en: lasted until the second you walked outta that school when you were a senior.
[Paul] In his 10th-grade year, Johnny got the start.
translation.ko: "타이비 대 본 2008년 2학년" 조니는 2학년 때 선발 쿼터백이 됐어요

translation.en: And I remember sitting in the stands and people are like,
"Who is this Manziel kid?" "There's some new kid starting tonight."
translation.ko: '맨젤이란 애가 누구야?' '웬 신참이 선발이래' "미셸 맨젤 - 어머니"

translation.en: I was like, "Oh my gosh, here we go."
[commentator] Here come the Antlers!
We ran a play called "tin trap", which is pretty much catch the ball,
translation.ko: '틴 트랩'이라는 작전을 썼는데 쉽게 말해서 공을 잡고

translation.en: they're gonna trap the noseguard,
translation.ko: 저쪽에서 노즈 가드를 트랩 하려고 하면

translation.en: and you're gonna run straight up the middle as fast as you can.
It just parted like the Red Sea.
You know, just a perfect alley right down the middle.
Took off, touchdown.
[commentator] Touchdown, Tivy.
And there's a yellow flag. Holding. It's called back.
translation.ko: 노란 깃발이 올라가고 홀딩으로 득점이 취소됐어요

translation.en: So now we're on the 10-yard line.
The coach signals in to play "Sky 2".
I look at the wristband.
I look down, I look up, I look at the sideline,
and this motherfucker called tin trap again.
translation.ko: 이 자식이 틴 트랩 작전을 또 하래요

translation.en: [commentator] Snap to Manziel. Looks like he's gonna take this one to the house!
translation.ko: 공이 맨젤에게 갑니다 엔드 존으로 곧장 갈 기세입니다

translation.en: [Johnny] Take it from the 10-yard line all the way to the house for a 90-yard touchdown.
translation.ko: 10야드 라인에서 엔드 존까지 달려 90야드 터치다운을 했죠

translation.en: [commentator] A 90-yard touchdown from Johnny Manziel.
[presenter] It all starts here
and on thousands of football fields like this all over the country.
translation.ko: 그리고 전국에 있는 풋볼 구장 수천 곳입니다

translation.en: It's where the quarterbacks of tomorrow learn their future skills.
translation.ko: 미래의 쿼터백들이 미래의 기술을 배우는 곳이죠

translation.en: [man] Everybody wants to be the quarterback.
Nobody's watching the nose tackle except for the nose tackle's wife and mother.
translation.ko: 아내와 어머니를 빼면 노즈 가드는 아무도 안 봐요

translation.en: I think the way that I played quarterback, it was just a different kind of football.
translation.ko: 제 쿼터백 플레이는 그 누구와도 달랐어요

translation.en: I always watched Brett Favre growing up, a guy who'd run around and make a ton of plays.
translation.ko: 어릴 때 브렛 파브르를 봤어요 사방을 누비며 플레이도 엄청 했죠

translation.en: Brett Favre, and I like Vince Young.
Vince Young is who I'd like to have my style known as.
translation.ko: 빈스 영 스타일이란 말을 듣고 싶어요

translation.en: There's a play that I will remember for the rest of my life.
Vince Young, pump fake…
[commentator] Great pump fake.
translation.ko: 빈스 영, 페이크를 시도합니다 멋진 페이크입니다

translation.en: …and the defender jumped.
Say goodbye to Vince Young.
It fit me how I wanted to play football. It fit me how I naturally played football.
translation.ko: 딱 제가 원하는 방식이었어요 제가 늘 하는 방식과 딱 맞았죠

translation.en: Always try to keep the elbow at least parallel with the shoulder.
translation.ko: 팔꿈치와 어깨는 항상 최소한 같은 높이로 유지하세요

translation.en: As a quarterback,
square your shoulders up with the line of scrimmage before delivering the ball.
translation.ko: 공을 던지기 전에 어깨를 스크리미지 라인과 맞춰야 해요

translation.en: You wanna see the ball secure, not flopping around.
[Johnny] Even though I was 5'10", maybe 5'11" on a good day,
you know, I didn't even have to think about it.
[commentator] Manziel. Touchdown, Antlers.
It was just run around and play backyard football,
and don't let that guy tackle you. Throw it to the guy that's open.
translation.ko: 태클을 당하면 안 되고 비어 있는 사람한테 던져요

translation.en: [Nate] I remember he straight-up hurdled a dude that was standing up straight.
translation.ko: 똑바로 서 있던 사람을 뛰어넘은 게 기억나요

translation.en: He was playing with children, and he would manhandle them.
translation.ko: 거의 아이들 다루듯 했죠 막 가지고 놀았어요

translation.en: [commentator] He had seven touchdowns in the first half last week against Fredericksburg.
You look at his numbers, and he has not disappointed it.
translation.ko: 숫자로 보면 조니는 실망시킨 적이 없어요

translation.en: [commentator 1] He picked up the Associated Press Player of the Year award.
translation.ko: AP 통신 선정 올해의 선수로 뽑혔습니다

translation.en: [commentator 2] Johnny Manziel certainly lives up to the hype.
[announcer] Touchdown. Touchdown, Johnny Manziel.
[commentator 3] Coming into senior season, check out these numbers. 3,609 yards.
Seventy-five touchdowns?
I thought that was a typo. I thought that was for his career, not this season!
translation.ko: 이번 시즌이 아니라 총계를 잘못 쓴 줄 알았어요

translation.en: [Johnny] My senior year, I started to get recruited a little bit.
Not anything crazy,
but I wanted to play football at the University of Texas.
translation.ko: 근데 전 텍사스 대학교에서 풋볼을 하고 싶었어요

translation.en: But I'd never really gotten anything
other than your basic, normal recruiting letters.
[Paul] He grew up with Longhorn T-shirts, Longhorn hats,
translation.ko: 조니는 롱혼 티셔츠에 롱혼 모자를 쓰고 자랐어요

translation.en: Longhorn this, Longhorn that,
and I really think that he always thought he'd go there, and it just didn't work out.
translation.ko: 줄곧 거기가 목표였나 본데 뜻대로 되지 않았습니다

translation.en: [Johnny] I remember walking into the office one day,
and my coach goes, "Texas A&M just offered you a full ride."
translation.ko: 코치가 텍사스 A&M 대학교에서 전액 장학금 제의가 왔대요

translation.en: [narrator] It is not a simple thing, the making of a quarterback.
It is the stuff of which legends are made.
[man narrating] Texas A&M was all male, all military for a long time.
translation.ko: 텍사스 A&M은 오랫동안 남성 전용 군사학교였어요

translation.en: A&M's always had a reputation as the blue-collar school of the state.
translation.ko: 예전부터 텍사스주의 노동 계급 학교로 유명했죠

translation.en: It's the roll-up-your-sleeves, it's the gritty school.
You know, back in the day,
it's where the people from the rural parts of Texas came to college.
translation.ko: 텍사스 시골 출신들이 "빌리 리우치 - 텍스애그스" 주로 가는 대학교였어요

translation.en: It's been interesting, the last 20 years or so,
because college football's changing.
[broadcaster] The Big 12 Conference is about to get smaller.
Texas A&M University gave its notice to the athletic conference,
said it plans to leave the league by next July.
translation.ko: 다음 해 7월까지 리그를 떠날 계획을 알렸습니다

translation.en: One of the things that we talk about in collegiate athletics,
translation.ko: 대학 체육에 관해 우리가 하는 말이 있는데 "앨런 캐넌 텍사스 A&M 체육부"

translation.en: the athletic department is the front porch to the university.
For more and more universities across the country,
success on the football field now equals a higher profile for the entire school.
translation.ko: 풋볼 구장에서의 승리가 곧 학교의 명성이 되고 있습니다

translation.en: [woman narrator] A&M is moving towards a jump to the Southeast Conference
as SEC is home to teams like Florida, Auburn, and LSU.
translation.ko: SEC에는 플로리다, 오번과 LSU 등이 속해 있죠

translation.en: We're talking about exposure, brand recognition,
translation.ko: 노출과 브랜드 인지도 10억 단위가 오가는 결정 등

translation.en: billion-dollar decisions here, and more.
Welcome to the SEC.
They were basically saying, "This is a defining moment in our program's history,"
translation.ko: '우리 대학팀의 역사적 순간이다' 그렇게 말하는 거죠

translation.en: but there were a lot of people that were wondering, "Is this the best move?"
translation.ko: 하지만 그게 최선인지 의심하는 사람들이 많았어요

translation.en: [commentator] We're talking about a football program
that's three games over .500 the last nine seasons.
We're not talking about a national superpower here.
At the time, we would've been considered middle of the road in the Big 12,
translation.ko: 당시 우리는 빅 12에서도 딱 평균으로만 보였겠죠

translation.en: and there was a national narrative that Texas A&M cannot compete in the SEC.
translation.ko: 텍사스 A&M은 SEC의 수준에 못 미친다는 게 정설이었습니다

translation.en: [commentator] The SEC has five national championships in a row.
They're going into the toughest league in the country. We all know that.
translation.ko: 미국에서 가장 힘든 리그에 진출하려는 거죠, 알아요

translation.en: And it's the toughest by a long shot.
[Billy] And then there was a coaching change.
I wanna welcome Kevin Sumlin as new head football coach at Texas A&M.
translation.ko: 텍사스 A&M의 새 감독인 케빈 섬린을 환영합니다

translation.en: They hired Kevin Sumlin,
and he had an offensive coordinator by the name of Kliff Kingsbury,
translation.ko: 케빈은 클리프 킹즈버리라는 공격 코디네이터를 데려왔죠

translation.en: and he had this wide-open, high-flying offense.
translation.ko: 클리프는 뻥 뚫린 하이플라잉 방식 공격을 했어요

translation.en: [journalist] How does this offense translate going against SEC defense?
translation.ko: SEC의 수비를 상대로 이 공격이 어떻게 펼쳐질까요?

translation.en: Hell, we'll find out. We'll find out.
[Billy] But what no one knew
was they had this kid from Kerrville, Texas,
translation.ko: 텍사스주 커빌에서 온 이 아이의 존재였죠

translation.en: this quarterback named Johnny Manziel.
One of Texas A&M's potential starting quarterbacks
translation.ko: 텍사스 A&M의 선발 쿼터백 후보 한 명이

translation.en: was arrested early this morning in Northgate.
Patrol officers say they saw two men fighting. One of the two was Manziel.
translation.ko: 두 남자가 난투극으로 체포됐는데 한 명이 맨젤이었습니다

translation.en: Johnny and one of his crappy high school friends were down in College Station,
translation.ko: "A&M 쿼터백 맨젤 체포" 조니와 한심한 고교 친구 하나가 칼리지스테이션에 있었는데

translation.en: ends up turning into a fight.
Johnny has a fake ID on him, goes to jail.
translation.ko: 조니는 위조 신분증 소지로 유치장에 갔어요

translation.en: You know, I don't have much of a recollection
other than waking up shirtless on a concrete bench in Bryan County Jail,
translation.ko: 웃통을 벗은 채로 브라이언 카운티 유치장의 콘크리트 의자에서 깨어났죠

translation.en: and they said that wasn't very, um, normal of my character.
translation.ko: 사람들은 그게 저답지 않은 짓이라고 했어요

translation.en: I guess looking back now, maybe it is a little bit normal
translation.ko: 지금 와서 돌아보면 약간은 저다운 일이었던 것 같아요

translation.en: for my character.
Johnny'd gotten in some trouble, but I remember Kliff Kingsbury telling me,
translation.ko: 조니가 말썽에 휘말렸어도 클리프 킹즈버리는 이렇게 말했죠

translation.en: "You know that's the guy, right? No matter what."
When he got in-line in fall camp, it was like a different human.
translation.ko: 가을 훈련에서 조니는 다른 사람이었어요 "클리프 킹즈버리 공격 코디네이터"

translation.en: It was like, "All right, y'all about to see why."
Our first game was at home at Kyle Field against the University of Florida,
translation.ko: 홈구장 카일 필드에서 플로리다 대학과 첫 시합을 했는데

translation.en: and Johnny Manziel's making his first start.
translation.ko: 그때 처음 조니 맨젤이 선발로 나섰습니다

translation.en: [commentator] Steps it outside, nothing doing.
Manziel just couldn't beat 'em with his arm.
Rough, rough sledding.
We end up losing 21-17, something like that.
I'm walking home, get to the end of the street right in front of the house,
translation.ko: 집으로 돌아가서 집 앞길 끝까지 왔는데

translation.en: and there are so many "for sale" signs in my yard,
translation.ko: 집 마당에 '판매'라는 간판이 잔뜩 있는 거예요

translation.en: and I just remember looking at 'em being like, "Welcome to the fucking SEC."

just what a great sound.

translation.ko: 감정이 북받치고 그 애를 키운 세월이 떠올랐어요

translation.en: To Mom, Dad, Meri, you mean the world to me.
translation.ko: 엄마, 아빠, 메리 세 사람은 제게 전부예요

translation.en: I just wanna thank you for the encouragement, the love, and the patience over the years.
translation.ko: 그동안 주신 격려와 사랑과 인내에 감사드립니다

translation.en: [Johnny] It was awesome to see how emotional my dad was
translation.ko: 아빠가 감정에 북받치는 걸 보니 기분 최고였죠

translation.en: and just how proud of me he was.
It's been a long time since I've seen him like that,
uh, so the impact that's had on me has been tremendous.
translation.ko: 그래서 그 일은 제게 엄청난 영향을 줬죠

translation.en: [Paul] As you raise your child, you wanna give him
translation.ko: 아이를 키우다 보면 아이가 원하는 걸 이룰 기회를 모두 주고 싶죠

translation.en: every opportunity to get to where he wants to be,
translation.ko: 아이가 원하는 걸 이룰 기회를 모두 주고 싶죠

translation.en: and, um, he achieved that tonight,
and, um, we're not done yet, but, um, he's definitely on his way.
translation.ko: 아직 다 이룬 건 아니지만 확실히 그걸 향해 가고 있죠

translation.en: [Meri] It all changed after the Heisman.
It becomes a little bit larger than football at that point.
Congratulations, Johnny, what are you gonna do with your prize money?
Did they give you money?
-I wish. -Yeah.
And then, after the Heisman, people started talking about money.
translation.ko: 하이즈먼 이후로 돈 얘기가 나오기 시작했어요

translation.en: What a year it has been.
Namely, Texas A&M's first year in the SEC.
And not only did Texas A&M compete, we excelled.
The nation knows him as Johnny Football,
translation.ko: 전 국민이 조니 풋볼로 알고 계신

translation.en: your 2012 Heisman Trophy winner, Johnny Manziel.
[all together] Johnny Football, hey, whoo!
I don't know if there's been a more impactful athlete for a university
translation.ko: 조니 풋볼보다 대학 체육에서 더 영향력 있는 선수가

translation.en: than Johnny Football and Texas A&M,
and everybody was along for the ride and… and benefiting.
translation.ko: 텍사스 A&M과 모두가 거기 편승해 이득을 봤죠

translation.en: And that's just a fact.
Whether it's Kevin Sumlin and… and his mega-contract he signed,
translation.ko: 케빈 섬린이 맺은 거액의 계약도 그렇고 "케빈 섬린 연봉 310만 달러에 계약 연장"

translation.en: Kliff Kingsbury and where his career went,
even our business, like, something that covers Texas A&M.
translation.ko: 심지어 텍사스 A&M과 관련된 우리 일도 그랬죠

translation.en: [woman] It certainly is bringing more visitors
and… and more Aggies and more SEC visitors to come in to see our community.
translation.ko: 더 많은 A&M과 SEC 팬들이 우리를 보러 왔죠

translation.en: We sold out all of the hotels in all of Bryan-College Station.
translation.ko: 브라이언과 칼리지스테이션의 호텔은 전부 꽉 찼어요

translation.en: [Kliff] There was nobody that was looking sideways
once we started winning and having the run we had.
translation.ko: 승리가 이어지자 의심의 눈초리는 전혀 없었어요

translation.en: I mean, everybody knew that they were gonna profit off this run.
translation.ko: 모두가 이 연승을 통해 이익을 얻을 걸 알았죠

translation.en: [Presenter] According to one estimate,
Manziel's Heisman has been worth $37 million
in free publicity for Texas A&M.
If you don't think it's easier to recruit professors after they see Johnny Manziel,
translation.ko: 조니 맨젤을 보여주면 교수를 뽑기가 쉽죠

translation.en: then you don't know much about public relations.
translation.ko: 그걸 모른다면 홍보를 잘 모르는 겁니다

translation.en: The people that benefited were the school. Hugely.
The Texas A&M Foundation raised more than $740 million,
translation.ko: 텍사스 A&M 재단의 모금액이 7억 4천만 달러를 넘어섰습니다

translation.en: $300 million more than any other one-year period in the university's history.
translation.ko: 이는 그 어느 해의 모금액보다 3억 달러가 더 많은 액수입니다

translation.en: -The donations just skyrocketed. -[rock music playing]
You know the saying, "Strike while the iron's hot." The iron was never hotter.
translation.ko: '쇠뿔도 단김에 빼라'라고 하죠 그때가 바로 그랬어요

translation.en: Because of Johnny's success,
people have a belief that Texas A&M can compete in the SEC.
translation.ko: 사람들은 텍사스 A&M이 SEC에서 통할 거라고 믿었죠

translation.en: So we need to upgrade.
[presenter] A makeover of Texas-sized proportions.
A&M proposed a renovation plan
that could fit more than 100,000 people in Kyle Field.
translation.ko: 카일 필드에 10만 명 이상을 수용할 계획입니다

translation.en: [Johnny] There were two times throughout the season
translation.ko: 그 시즌에 몇백 번씩 사인을 해야 하는 일이

translation.en: where I had to sign hundreds and hundreds of autographs.
translation.ko: 그 시즌에 몇백 번씩 사인을 해야 하는 일이 두 번 정도 있었습니다

translation.en: We had 'em all lined out for all of our donors.
translation.ko: 기부자들에게 줄 물품들이 온통 널려 있는데

translation.en: This is where, I guess, I see a little bit behind the scenes,
kind of what they were doing through that year for donations and building a new stadium.
translation.ko: 기부금과 경기장 신축을 위해 그 해 내내 진행되던 일들을요

translation.en: I was tired of not having any money,
and I sure as hell saw "45 million No 2 A&M Adidas jerseys sold."
translation.ko: 등 번호 2번 A&M 유니폼이 4,500만 달러어치 팔렸대요

translation.en: It didn't make any sense, and…
…I had a bone to pick. [sighs]
Football is an industry that makes billions of dollars every year
translation.ko: 풋볼은 매년 수십억 달러를 벌어들이는 산업입니다

translation.en: at both the pro and collegiate levels.
And while professional players can count on fat paychecks,
college athletes can't make a dime.
translation.ko: 대학 선수들은 한 푼도 못 법니다

translation.en: I have a deep hatred against the NCAA.
translation.ko: 전 전미 대학 체육 협회 NCAA에 원한이 깊어요

translation.en: Athletes argue the organization continues to profit off student-athletes
translation.ko: NCAA가 정당한 보상 없이 학생 선수들을 이용해 돈을 번다는

translation.en: without giving them a fair cut.
In 2012, the NCAA was basically, um, set up to make sure
there was a level playing field in college football.
translation.ko: 대학 풋볼은 모두에게 동등함을 확실히 밝힌 셈이었어요

translation.en: [presenter] The NCAA president testified that any effort to pay players
translation.ko: NCAA 회장은 선수들에게 금전적 보수를 주면

translation.en: would destroy a framework that has been in place for more than a century.
We provide students with access to education,
and there's not even a salary to debate. They're not employees. They're students.
You're allowed to have a full scholarship, you're allowed to get meals,
translation.ko: 장학금을 받을 수 있고 식사도 제공받고

translation.en: have your books paid for, classes, housing,
and that was basically it.
The idea of athletes being paid,
do you think that will ever happen at the NCAA level?
translation.ko: NCAA 차원에서 그런 일이 일어날 수 있을까요?

translation.en: Not while I'm president of the NCAA.
There was no marketing deals, there's no advertising deals.
You… You couldn't make money off your likeness or image, none of that.
translation.ko: 외모나 이미지 등 그 무엇으로도 돈을 벌 수 없었죠

translation.en: He knew everybody was making a ton of money
translation.ko: 조니는 다들 돈을 왕창 벌고 있는 걸 알았어요

translation.en: out of Johnny Football mania, so, "Hey! I'm gonna try to get mine."
translation.ko: 조니 풋볼의 열혈 팬들 덕에요 그래서 '받아야겠다' 한 거죠

translation.en: [Johnny] It all started at a national championship game in my freshman year.
translation.ko: 1학년 때 전국 선수권 대회에서 모든 게 시작됐어요

translation.en: Me and Nate flew down to Miami. I'm sitting there waiting on our bags,
translation.ko: 네이트랑 마이애미 공항에서 가방이 나오길 기다리는데

translation.en: and this guy comes out to me, and he's like, "I've got some money for you if you wanna sign,"
translation.ko: 웬 남자가 와서는 이러더군요 '사인만 하면 돈을 드리죠'

translation.en: and I just kinda blew the guy off a little bit, and he's like,
"Yo, I've got $3,000 for you to sign."
And I remember taking my headphones off and turning around looking at this guy like…
translation.ko: 전 헤드폰을 벗고 그 남자를 이렇게 봤어요

translation.en: [inhales] "Where are we going?"
They've got liquor. They've got everything to make it fun.
translation.ko: 술도 있었고 재미있는 건 다 있었어요

translation.en: As we're kinda hours into this whole deal, one of the guys is like,
translation.ko: 몇 시간쯤 있었는데 한 남자가 와서는

translation.en: "This guy's fucking you over," and slid me a number.
translation.ko: 저 사람은 제값을 안 쳐준다며 제게 번호를 줬어요

translation.en: He's like, "Trust me, like, the king of all autographs is downstairs
translation.ko: '내 말 믿어요, 밑에 사인의 왕이 있어요' 하더군요

translation.en: and you guys are getting hosed totally on the count, the money."
"It's all… It's all screwed. You gotta go downstairs."
translation.ko: '이건 말도 안 돼요 일단 내려가 봐요'

translation.en: There was like a black Rolls-Royce Dawn out front.
He's like, "Hey, hold up," and I look up on the thing, and it was Alex Rodriguez calling.
He's like, "Tell this dude I'm good,"
translation.ko: 그 사람이 알렉스에게 말 좀 해달라고 하니

translation.en: and I remember him just like, "100%, he's good."
translation.ko: 그 사람이 알렉스에게 말 좀 해달라고 하니 알렉스가 믿어도 된대요

translation.en: I'm like, "Can't argue with that."
[Johnny] "Here's what we're gonna do. I'm gonna get a room at the Fontainebleau."
"I'm gonna set everything up in there."
"When you get done, shoot me a picture, and I'll give you the code to the safe."
translation.ko: '다 마치고 사진 찍어 보내면 금고 비밀번호를 드리죠'

translation.en: "Thirty grand."
And once that happened for the first time, it was, like, game on.
Constructing the business was really just logic.
And I hate to even call it a business because it wasn't really a business. It was just, um…
translation.ko: 사업이라는 말은 별로지만요 사업이 아니라 그냥…

translation.en: Well, it was a business.
We were going back once in February, once in March, once in April, once in May.
translation.ko: 2월에 한 번, 3월에 한 번 4월에 한 번, 5월에 한 번

translation.en: Business is booming.
For a 19-year-old kid to have about 100 grand in cash stuffed under your bed,
it was awesome.
You have to also understand, we weren't just signing autographs.
translation.ko: 이걸 아셔야 해요 우린 그냥 사인만 한 게 아니에요

translation.en: [Johnny] Cabo. California.
Not looking good for the Padres.
[Nate] All over the place. Throwing a dart on a map.
Finish our drinks, go straight to the airport.
translation.ko: 술을 몽땅 비우면 곧장 공항으로 가죠

translation.en: Wake up and we're like, "What are we doing in Washington, DC?"
translation.ko: 잠에서 깨면 이랬어요 '워싱턴 DC엔 왜 왔지?'

translation.en: [commentator] How does a college kid get courtside seats? They are expensive seats.
translation.ko: 대학생이 어떻게 값비싼 코트 사이드 좌석을 구하죠?

translation.en: [Nate] We went to LIV Nightclub, which was big at the time.
translation.ko: LIV 나이트클럽에도 갔어요 당시 엄청 유명했죠

translation.en: The next thing I know, Rick Ross is just passing us these purple bottles.
translation.ko: 정신 차려보니 릭 로스가 보라색 병을 막 주더라고요

translation.en: -[crowd cheering] -[woman] He's one of your boys, clearly.
Johnny's like one of the best guys,
and I feel like our friendship will last for… for a very long time.
[Nate] We went to the Super Bowl, first row, 50-yard line.
We went to Maxim Magazine party
and had drinks with Jamie Foxx, with Andy Roddick.
translation.ko: 제이미 폭스와 앤디 로딕과 술을 마셨죠

translation.en: Met up with Wale, Justin Timberlake, and Jessica Biel that night.
translation.ko: 그날 밤 웨일, 저스틴 팀버레이크 제시카 비엘을 만났고요

translation.en: None of them could believe he was there.
I'm going in my head 'cause I'm 20 years old,
I'm so badass.
And I remember… [laughs] …I got this silk Versace shirt,
translation.ko: 실크 베르사체 셔츠를 산 게 기억나요

translation.en: Gucci sunglasses.
And I still, to this day, have the first Gucci wallet that I ever, ever bought.
translation.ko: 처음 산 구찌 지갑은 아직도 가지고 있어요

translation.en: There's still the price tag there.
So I thought this was, like, the coolest thing in the world.
We make this list of what do we wanna accomplish in our life,
translation.ko: 인생에서 이루고 싶은 일의 목록을 만들잖아요

translation.en: you know, what do we wanna do?
[Nate] He's like, "I don't know. You write yours, and I'll write mine."
[Johnny] You know, "Make a million dollars, go see this, go see that."
All those stupid things you do as a kid, you know, we did together.
translation.ko: 어릴 때 흔히 하는 그런 바보 같은 짓들을 했죠

translation.en: [Nate] He's in my ear the whole time telling me we're the baddest thing
translation.ko: 조니가 계속 저한테 그랬어요 우리가 세상에서 가장 멋지다고 신나게 달리자고요

translation.en: that ever existed, and "Let's roll."
translation.ko: 우리가 세상에서 가장 멋지다고 신나게 달리자고요

translation.en: "This is what life is like forever."
And I thought that it was at the time.
[Johnny] This train was going full speed ahead…
[inhales] …and it didn't really stop until the NCAA got involved.
Texas A&M star quarterback, Johnny Manziel, has come under scrutiny this week.
translation.ko: 텍사스 A&M의 스타 쿼터백 조니 맨젤이 조사를 받았습니다

translation.en: Accused of signing sports memorabilia for money.
translation.ko: 스포츠 기념품에 돈을 받고 사인한 혐의입니다

translation.en: I go to my dad, and I was like, "Oh shit," like, "I… I really fucked up."
translation.ko: "조니 맨젤, 중개인에게 뒷돈 받은 혐의" 아빠한테 가서 그랬죠 '젠장, 제가 다 망쳤어요'

translation.en: Johnny calls me, he says, "Hey, I'm being investigated. What do I do?"
translation.ko: 조니가 전화해서 그러더군요 '저 조사받고 있어요, 어떡하죠?'

translation.en: I said, "Don't say a word. Don't do nothing."
translation.ko: 전 그랬죠, '아무 말도 하지 마 아무것도 하지 마'

translation.en: Here we go again.
There may be two other questionable autograph-signing sessions.
translation.ko: 의심스러운 사인회가 두 건 더 있습니다

translation.en: There's growing concern Johnny Manziel may not even be in uniform…
translation.ko: 조니 맨젤의 선수 생활이 끝날 우려도 있습니다

translation.en: The NCAA had an entire division
that was dedicated to finding athletes breaking the rules.
That is no joke.
Johnny Football could lose part of his eligibility, if not all.
translation.ko: 조니 풋볼은 일부 자격을 박탈당할 수도 있습니다

translation.en: Is this the end for Manziel?
But we had already formed an immaculate defense.
translation.ko: 하지만 우리는 이미 완벽한 방어책을 세웠죠

translation.en: We talked, and I devised a plan that was brilliant.
translation.ko: "사건의 의문 더 밝혀져" 상의를 했는데 제가 기발한 계획을 짜냈죠

translation.en: I started with, "How does he get caught?"
He gets caught because somebody takes a picture during a paid autograph session.
translation.ko: 유료 사인회에서 찍힌 사진 때문이었어요 "헬멧과 공에 사인하고 7,500달러 받아"

translation.en: You can sign autographs all you want.
The part you have to conceal is money being paid.
You have all this cash, can't go buy a flight,
translation.ko: 현금이 잔뜩 있는데 비행기 표도 못 사요

translation.en: so I remember calling my grandpa one day and asking him,
"Hey, is there any way that I can, you know, give you some cash,
and then you're able to give me a check,
so I'm able to put some money into the bank account?"
And my grandpa's a fucking G.
You know, Nate was very okay with being the fall guy.
And with that,
me and Nate split everything 80-20.
[Nate] The next step is,
how are you gonna explain why you are wearing Rolexes
translation.ko: 제가 설명해야 할 건 어떻게 롤렉스를 차고

translation.en: and driving new cars and flying in private jets?
translation.ko: 새 차를 몰고 개인 제트기를 타느냐였죠

translation.en: As a freshman, you weren't allowed to talk to the media,
but they were allowed to talk to me.
And so the biggest spin that still exists today,
translation.ko: 그래서 오늘날까지 남아 있는 최고의 헛소문을 퍼뜨렸죠

translation.en: I invented a narrative that his family was vastly wealthy.
translation.ko: 조니의 집안이 거부라는 이야기를 제가 지어낸 겁니다

translation.en: [Johnny] I've been blessed with family members that have had these opportunities,
translation.ko: 유복한 가정에서 태어났으니 전 운이 좋았죠

translation.en: and I've always been able to do this.
We sold a little bit of a dream that my family had more money, um, than they actually did.
translation.ko: 우리 집안이 실제보다 돈이 많다는 꿈을 팔았죠

translation.en: What's interesting is here's a kid who doesn't need money.
translation.ko: 흥미로운 건 이 친구가 딱히 돈이 필요 없다는 겁니다

translation.en: He comes from oil money.
A kid who came from oil money.
We're not doing anything criminal.
We're just not abiding by the NCAA bylaws on which you're not allowed to make money.
translation.ko: NCAA의 수익 활동 금지 조례를 어겼을 뿐이죠

translation.en: Well, Johnny Football suspended for half a game.
translation.ko: 조니 풋볼은 반 경기 출장 정지를 받았습니다

translation.en: The NCAA says there is no evidence that Manziel took money,
translation.ko: NCAA는 맨젤이 돈을 받았다는 증거는 없지만

translation.en: but he still violated the rules by signing certain photographs.
translation.ko: 특정 사진에 사인한 게 규칙 위반이라고 합니다

translation.en: They, um, penalized him half a game
for failure to prevent the commercialization of his name.
translation.ko: 자기 이름의 상업화를 막지 못했다는 이유로요

translation.en: And we went right back to signing autographs.
The last time the reigning Heisman Trophy winner returned to play in the SEC
translation.ko: 하이즈먼 트로피 수상자가 SEC 경기에 복귀한 경우는

translation.en: was Tim Tebow back in 2007.
Now, it's this man's turn.
[presenter] The one person that everybody had their eyes on earlier this morning
was Johnny Football.
Once he won the Heisman,
I saw a different side of him.
It was like there was nothing stopping him from doing what he wanted to do.
translation.ko: 뭘 해야겠다고 작정하면 아무도 말리질 못했죠

translation.en: [Johnny] What was going on with the NCAA,
for years and years and years, was just wrong,
and I went into that suspension pissed,
but also with the biggest smirk on my face ever.
And then, from then on out, everything I really did
just got absolutely nitpicked and torn apart.
People saying, "He's traveling around the world,
he's done Jay Leno, he hasn't been at practice very much."
Fuck your practice. I'm the best player in the country.
translation.ko: 훈련 좋아하시네 전 전국 최고의 선수라고요

translation.en: [presenter] Manziel caught a lot of heat from the media after leaving the Manning Passing Academy.
translation.ko: 매닝 패싱 아카데미를 나서며 언론의 포화를 받았습니다

translation.en: Some reports say Manziel was hungover and missed camp.
translation.ko: 숙취로 훈련에 빠졌는지 묻는 질문도 있었죠

translation.en: [journalist] What happened on the weekend?
Um, nothing… nothing more than I overslept.
I was a shark in a fish tank,
and I didn't really feel like I had any way to move.
[presenter] Early Sunday morning, Manziel posted a quote,
translation.ko: 맨젤의 일요일 아침 트윗입니다 '젠장, 오늘 같은 밤이면 칼리지스테이션을 뜨고 싶다'

translation.en: [woman] Manziel was reportedly quickly and harshly removed from a frat party.
[Johnny] I like to have fun in my life.
I like to live my life to the fullest, and if that upsets some people, I'm sorry.
translation.ko: 삶을 최대한 누리고 싶지만 불편함을 드렸다면 죄송합니다

translation.en: What Johnny needed was to be held accountable.
When you turn your son over to a coach and to a program,
they're supposed to not only teach him how to play football,
translation.ko: 거기서는 풋볼에 관해서만 가르치는 게 아니라

translation.en: they're responsible to turn him into a good young man.
[Kliff] I always felt you had to be careful
on trying to tell Johnny how to live his life.
translation.ko: 조니에게 삶의 방식에 관해 조언을 할 때는요

translation.en: Wasn't ideal I think, for us as coaches,
but it was kinda like, that's the dark side he needed to play good,
translation.ko: 하지만 좋은 경기를 위해 감당해야 할 이면이었어요

translation.en: and as long as he wasn't getting in trouble, um,
do your deal.
[Kevin] Um, nobody's really ever been in this situation.
We've been very clear with Johnny and his family about the dos and don'ts,
translation.ko: 우린 조니와 가족에게 되는 것과 안 되는 걸 명확히 알려줬습니다

translation.en: but, um, there's not a perfect person in this room.
translation.ko: 하지만 여기 있는 그 누구도 완벽하지 않죠

translation.en: [Paul] For the school, how do you take him out and waste a season?
translation.ko: 학교에서 조니를 빼고 한 시즌을 버릴 수 있나요?

translation.en: How do you do that, financially or anything else?
Y… You don't.
[presenter] So the suspension
that many around college football felt was just a joke is now history,
translation.ko: 장난으로 여기는 분위기였는데 이젠 역사가 됐어요

translation.en: and Johnny Manziel is a college football player again.
translation.ko: 조니 맨젤은 다시 대학 풋볼에 출전합니다

translation.en: [crowd cheering] Johnny! Johnny! Johnny! Johnny!
[commentator] In for his first snap of 2013.
And Manziel takes off.
There goes Johnny Football!
That's why they love him here in College Station.
Here's his other standard move after a touchdown.
translation.ko: 터치다운 후 또 저 제스처를 취하네요

translation.en: All this money thing that he started doing,
I didn't like it, but people begged for that.
translation.ko: 전 마음에 안 들었지만 사람들은 열광했어요

translation.en: [woman shouting] Show me the money, baby!
[presenter] This season started with enormous expectations for Johnny Manziel.
translation.ko: 조니 맨젤은 큰 기대를 받으며 시즌을 시작했죠

translation.en: Perhaps his second Heisman Trophy, SEC National Championship.
translation.ko: 하이즈먼 트로피 연속 수상이나 SEC 전국 선수권 대회라든가요

translation.en: [commentator] Third of the half for Johnny Football.
translation.ko: 조니 풋볼의 전반전 세 번째 터치다운입니다

translation.en: Following the touchdown, unsportsmanlike conduct,
No 2 of the offense, 15-yard penalty…
There were people trying to put discipline on me.
[Kevin] That's not okay, and obviously, I addressed that
translation.ko: 그러면 안 되죠 제가 단단히 일렀습니다

translation.en: on the sideline right after the play.
[Johnny] But at the same time,
nobody knew how to handle everything that was going on.
translation.ko: 다들 절 어떻게 해야 할지 몰랐죠

translation.en: There is a code of conduct for the reigning Heisman winner,
and he violated it once again.
He's hanging out with Drake and LeBron, and he's coming home…
You think he cared what came out of me and Paul's mouth?
translation.ko: 저랑 폴의 말은 귓등으로도 안 들었죠

translation.en: At that point, you were like… Didn't matter.
[man] This guy's been partying since he stepped into College Station,
translation.ko: 칼리지스테이션에 온 후로 줄곧 파티 중이에요

translation.en: so I think he's just being himself.
[woman] Can college football take three more years of Johnny Football?
translation.ko: 대학 풋볼이 앞으로 3년 더 조니 풋볼을 견딜 수 있을까요?

translation.en: [commentator] Say whatever you want about Johnny Manziel,
if you can watch one player in college football, you wanna watch him.
translation.ko: 대학 풋볼 선수를 한 명만 보라면 조니를 보겠죠

translation.en: [Johnny] I'm getting approached by agents knowing if I come back out this year,
translation.ko: 제가 올해 복귀한다는 걸 알고 에이전트들이 접촉해 왔어요

translation.en: and I recreate even a smidgen of that success,
translation.ko: 그 성공을 아주 조금이라도 되풀이할 수 있다면

translation.en: I'm gonna have millions of dollars and be the first quarterback taken in the draft.
translation.ko: 수백만 달러를 벌고 쿼터백 1순위로 드래프트 되겠죠

translation.en: [presenter] Biggest question involving the former Heisman winner
translation.ko: 조니 맨젤을 둘러싼 가장 중요한 질문은

translation.en: is whether he should head to the pros while his draft stock is looking so bright.
translation.ko: 드래프트 전망이 좋은 상황에서 프로로 갈 것이냐입니다

translation.en: [Johnny] I bitched out on workouts
and felt like I didn't have to do what everybody else was doing,
translation.ko: 다른 사람들처럼 할 필요가 없다고 생각했어요

translation.en: and that whole idea and mantra I had in my head from Kerrville of,
"You're gonna dress the same way, do the same thing as the guy next to you,"
translation.ko: '옆에 있는 사람과 똑같이 입고 똑같이 해라'였는데

translation.en: was completely eliminated in six months' time.
[commentator] Got a feeling Johnny Manziel's a little frustrated.
[Paul] I think all of the expectation, the partying, the NCAA stuff,
translation.ko: 그 모든 기대와 파티 NCAA 일, A&M, 모든 압박감에

translation.en: all the A&M, all the pressure,
I think it changed him.
[commentator] There's a reaction on the sidelines from A&M's leader, Johnny Manziel.
translation.ko: A&M의 리더 조니 맨젤이 사이드라인에서 항의하고 있네요

translation.en: [Kevin] The thing that makes him who he is, is his passion and emotion.
translation.ko: 조니를 조니로 만드는 건 열정과 감정이에요

translation.en: It's our challenge to try to keep that energy positive.
translation.ko: 그 에너지를 긍정적으로 유지하는 게 우리 과제죠

translation.en: [presenter] Johnny Manziel just can't help himself.
You draw the line in the sand, he steps over that line.
translation.ko: 모래에 선을 그으면 그 선을 넘어버려요

translation.en: [man] Let's remember this. This problem did not happen last year.
translation.ko: 생각해 보세요 작년에는 이런 문제가 없었어요

translation.en: [shouting] Turn the fuck up!
Last week was one
of his most disappointing games since he's been at Texas A&M.
translation.ko: A&M에서 들어온 후 가장 실망스러운 경기를 했죠

translation.en: [presenter] And the ovation for Johnny Manziel
along with these seniors as they close the door on Kyle Field.
translation.ko: 조니 맨젤과 졸업반 선수들에게 갈채가 쏟아집니다

translation.en: [Johnny] There's no reason the team we had should be eight and four that year.
translation.ko: 그 해에 우리 팀이 8승 4패인 건 말이 안 됐죠 "카일 필드"

translation.en: We were better than that.
But it didn't matter
'cause you're looking at mock drafts and you're looking forward and…
translation.ko: 제 관심사는 모의 드래프트와 제 장래였으니까요

translation.en: whether people like to say it or not, I was bigger than College Station.
translation.ko: 누가 뭐래도 칼리지스테이션은 제게 너무 작았어요

translation.en: So it was just kinda time to move on and go do the next thing.
translation.ko: 이제 다음 단계로 넘어가 다음 일을 할 차례였죠

translation.en: Johnny Manziel made it official today, no surprise,
translation.ko: 오늘 공식 발표에 따르면 맨젤은 예상대로

translation.en: announcing he's gonna leave college to enter the NFL draft.
translation.ko: 대학을 떠나 NFL 드래프트에 참가할 예정입니다

translation.en: [presenter] The big question, "Where will Manziel go in the draft?"
translation.ko: 중요한 질문은 이 드래프트에서 맨젤이 어디로 가느냐죠

translation.en: I think I was considered a very risky person, um, for him
translation.ko: 제가 조니에게 무척 위험한 인물로 보였나 봐요

translation.en: 'cause I knew everything.
And so I think that the counsel he was receiving at the time
was probably sound advice, which is like,
"Hey, you're no longer doing this half-ass, 20-year-old management."
I… I just knew I was super loyal,
and that I contributed everything, mind, body, soul, spirit, to help him,
translation.ko: 몸과 마음과 영혼, 모든 걸 조니를 돕는 데 바쳤죠

translation.en: erm, and an image needed to change from being best friend
to it needed to be a big firm.
[Johnny] We'd originally told him that there wasn't gonna be a guy with me in the day-to-day,
translation.ko: 네이트한테 제 일상을 관리하는 전담 매니저는 없을 거라고 했어요

translation.en: and when we told him that wasn't gonna happen,
I kinda think, like, he felt his role and the whole role was diminished,
translation.ko: 네이트는 자기 역할이 줄어들었다고 느꼈나 봐요

translation.en: and kinda pulled away.
[inhales] And I don't think we've spoken again since then.
translation.ko: 그 이후로 우린 대화한 적 없는 것 같아요

translation.en: You know, for me, this is what we'd talked about flying on those planes to South Beach.
translation.ko: 사우스비치로 가는 비행기에서 다 한 이야기인 줄 알았어요

translation.en: You know, this is what we talked about at the Fontainebleau sitting by the pool.
translation.ko: 퐁텐블로에서 수영장 가에 앉아 이야기한 것도 이거고요

translation.en: So, you know, I felt terrible about it, but at the same time,
because of what my track record was, they weren't gonna allow me to do that.
translation.ko: 제 전력 때문에 어차피 안 될 일이었어요

translation.en: And Nate being away was probably a safeguard for a while.
[Nate] I didn't care about the business side of it.
Truly, I didn't.
The only thing I was hurting about was that I loved Johnny.
translation.ko: 제가 상처받은 건 오로지 조니에 대한 애정 때문이에요

translation.en: He was my best friend.
I was, um… unbelievably loyal to my guys.
translation.ko: 전 제 친구들에게 최선을 다해 의리를 지켰습니다

translation.en: U… Until you really can't be anymore.
Yeah, I'm Erik Burkhardt.
Um, I was Johnny's sports agent for way too many years.
So it's such a big deal,
especially for a quarterback, if they can go in the first round,
translation.ko: 특히 쿼터백의 경우라면 정말 중요한 일이에요

translation.en: because if he goes top five, we're talking 20 to 25 million.
And every pick in the first round, the money starts falloff about a million dollars.
translation.ko: 1차에서 한 명 뽑힐 때마다 백만 달러씩 떨어지죠

translation.en: So many people had been making millions of dollars
on the back of Johnny and his teammates, largely after that Heisman year.
translation.ko: 수백만 달러를 벌었어요 주로 하이즈먼 수상 이후로요

translation.en: He earned this contract, which was still gonna be peanuts
translation.ko: 조니는 이 계약을 따냈지만 여전히 푼돈이었어요

translation.en: compared to what so many other people had made on his back the whole time.
translation.ko: 그동안 수많은 사람들이 조니 덕분에 번 것에 비하면요

translation.en: I was real. I didn't come in saying, "You're gonna go top ten."
translation.ko: 전 솔직히 말했죠 '넌 10위에 들 거야'가 아니라

translation.en: I came and I go, "You're not going in the first round."
He does not belong in the top 25.
He may get a bump to second round. He's not getting in the first round.
The big questions on Johnny were gonna be, "Do you really wanna be a quarterback,
translation.ko: 조니에게 중요한 질문은 쿼터백이 되고 싶은지

translation.en: or do you wanna be famous?" 'Cause he was super famous already.
translation.ko: 아니면 유명해지고 싶은지였죠 왜냐하면 이미 유명했거든요

translation.en: There's things Johnny's gotta answer moving forward
to be a quarterback and be a leader.
We can leave no doubt. For somebody to take your fucked-up ass in the first round,
translation.ko: 터놓고 말했죠, 너 같은 놈이 1차에서 뽑히려면

translation.en: here's what this strategy needs to look like.
[Johnny] I'm going straight to San Diego and I'm getting right into this pre-draft training.
translation.ko: 샌디에이고로 가서 드래프트 전 훈련에 돌입했습니다

translation.en: Come right back.
[Erik] So, number one: We're doing no PR.
The only thing coming outta your socials is you sweating and working your ass off.
translation.ko: SNS에서는 땀 흘리며 열심히 훈련하는 모습만 보이고요

translation.en: You need to gain some weight, learn the game, no drinking,
and when you show up at the NFL Combine in two months,
now they're really gonna start considering you.
You know, 6:30, 7:00 in the morning until seven, eight o'clock at night,
and you just do it on repeat over and over and over again.
translation.ko: 그냥 계속 반복하고 또 하는 거예요

translation.en: [Erik] We're gonna go crazy and do a record-setting Nike deal through LeBron's team,
translation.ko: 르브론의 팀을 끼고 나이키와 엄청난 계약을 했죠

translation.en: but we're gonna do those in silence.
I was drug testing him every other week
'cause I know that's gonna come up, and I wanna be able to go,
translation.ko: 나중에 실제 검사 때 이렇게 하려고요

translation.en: "Here's 25 drug tests. I've been testing him."
"'Cause when I signed him, I didn't know what I was dealing with,
but I wanted you to have peace of mind."
You need to own who you were and what you've done.
translation.ko: 자신을, 자신이 한 일을 인정해야 해요

translation.en: I was like, "We're gonna embrace who you were
and say, 'Okay, but now it's time to go be a pro, and I'm gonna grow up.'"
translation.ko: '좋아, 하지만 이젠 프로가 되고 성장할 때야'

translation.en: And that was my expectation that he actually would.
translation.ko: 전 조니가 실제로 그럴 거라고 예상했어요

translation.en: I was really, really good until the week before the combine in Indy,
translation.ko: 콤바인이 시작하기 일주일 전까진 정말 잘했어요

translation.en: and I finally just broke.
He calls me, and he's like,
"EB, I fucked up."
[tsks] Like, "How bad?"
I didn't remember much of the night.
translation.ko: 그날 밤은 기억이 잘 안 나요

translation.en: I woke up in a hotel room, and didn't know how I got there.
translation.ko: 호텔 방에서 깨어났는데 어떻게 왔는지 몰랐어요

translation.en: "Dude, I went to a party last night in the Hills."
He's like, "Man, everyone was there. Man, all the rappers, all the actresses."
translation.ko: 이러더군요, '다들 와 있었어요 래퍼들, 여배우들, 다요'

translation.en: I mean, I didn't know, going into Indy, if I was really gonna be able
translation.ko: 인디애나폴리스로 가는데 약물 검사를 통과할지 자신이 없었어요

translation.en: to pass a drug test.
He's clean the whole time before that.
The only thing I've ever been told was, "Fail a drug test at the combine,
translation.ko: 에릭이 몇 번이나 말했어요 콤바인에서 약물 검사에 걸리면

translation.en: and you're gonna go from first-round pick to maybe undrafted."
They're gonna drug test you day two here.
He's like, "EB, I've been watching the NFL combine."
"I'm coming to the combine."
I say, "No, you're not." There… We're not risking this, so we compromise.
translation.ko: 전 오지 말라고 했죠 위험하니 타협점을 찾아야 했어요

translation.en: I call Paul and Michelle. I'm like, "Okay,
you are checking yourself in the hospital, Paul, with, like, fucking heavy heart,
translation.ko: '병원에 입원하세요, 폴 심장이나 뭐 그런 거로요'

translation.en: so that Johnny can divert and come to the combine for 12 hours,
so that it doesn't look weird,
and put him on a plane down to see Dad who's in the hospital."
"I'm so sorry, but we'll reschedule these interviews."
That was my strategy, and Paul's like, "Okay, Michelle, you're going,"
translation.ko: 제 전략을 들은 폴이 미셸에게 입원하라고 했고

translation.en: and, like, she's crying, "I knew he would do this."
translation.ko: 미셸이 울면서 말했어요 '걔가 이럴 줄 알았어'

translation.en: I'm like, "Fuck."
He's like, "I don't even get there till tomorrow, bro."
"I'm gonna chug a gallon of fucking water. "I'll piss this shit out. Trust me."
He goes, "I… I've been passing these tests at A&M for a while,"
which I come to find out on my own
it was their, like, fourth-string backup quarterback
-that was pissing for him at A&M. -[smirks]
-So how's the day been? -It's been really good.
A little early morning, but we're kinda in the mood now, in the swing of things.
translation.ko: 아직 이른 시간이지만 기분도 좋고 분위기 탔어요

translation.en: I get, like, three gallons of water, a bunch of Pedialyte,
translation.ko: 전 물 3갤런에 전해질 음료를 왕창 구해 왔죠

translation.en: and four drug tests.
There's, like, six hotels at the combine. So every team's, like, staying at these same hotels.
translation.ko: 콤바인 선수 호텔이 6곳인데 모든 팀이 다 거기 묵거든요

translation.en: We get on the elevator, and up… Comes on.
Two general managers and a college scouting director get on the elevator.
translation.ko: 총지배인 두 명과 대학 스카우트 책임자가 탔어요

translation.en: I'm holding the drug tests, like, trying to hide them.
translation.ko: 전 약물 검사 키트를 급히 감췄죠

translation.en: We go to my room.
We're, like, holding his piss up in the bathroom of my hotel room,
translation.ko: 제 방 화장실에서 소변 검사를 했는데

translation.en: and it's, like… it's a little ambiguous.
Johnny's just crushing liquids.
We take our second one. It's a little lighter.
translation.ko: 검사를 다시 했더니 약간 더 희석됐어요

translation.en: So he's like, "Ha ha ha! We got this shit."
I was like, "Keep drinking."
What was that process like?
It was really cool to see… to see a bunch of these coaches I've seen on TV and…
translation.ko: TV에서 보던 코치들을 보니 정말 좋던데요

translation.en: By the way, he of course crushed his interviews.
In fact, rave reviews out of the combine on how great he did.
translation.ko: 사실 콤바인에서 너무 잘했다는 극찬이 쏟아졌죠

translation.en: And that was a very, very, um, scary thing,
one that I think snapped me out of it for a little bit,
translation.ko: 덕분에 잠깐 정신이 반짝 든 것 같아요

translation.en: and then once I got through that unscathed, um…
you know, kinda let loose a little bit more.
[presenter] It was a pro day done the Johnny Manziel way.
translation.ko: 조니 맨젤 식으로 보낸 프로 데이였습니다

translation.en: [Erik] The next step is pro day where he's gonna do the on-the-field.
translation.ko: 다음 단계는 프로 데이예요 구장에서 보여주는 거죠

translation.en: I go to multiple pro days every year, there will never be another like this.
translation.ko: 매년 프로 데이에 여러 번 가는데 이런 날은 또 없을 거예요

translation.en: [presenter] A huge crowd at College Station.
George and Barbara Bush even showing up.
Manziel's performance receiving universal praise.

translation.en: Our strategy's working. The buzz is like, "He could go."
[woman] Most experts agree he's gonna be a top-ten pick.
[man] He'll be a top-ten pick.
At that point, our strategy was just throw his ass in a cave, lock him up.

translation.en: After I got through my pro day, I felt like a majority of the work had been done.

translation.en: Will the Houston Texans pick Johnny Manziel first?
Houston, number-one pick.
The buzz is building in the city.
[presenter] All around Houston, billboards are up to bring Johnny Football back to Texas.
translation.ko: '조니 풋볼을 텍사스로' 휴스턴 곳곳에 세워진 간판입니다

translation.en: He got involved with a big charity foundation event.
translation.ko: 그러다가 대형 자선 재단 행사에 참여했어요

Johnny ends up, like, donating his own money to the cause.

The next day, I get a call.
"He was golfing today at River Oaks Country Club,"

translation.ko: 조니가 5번 홀에서 잔뜩 취해 셔츠를 벗었다는 이야기가

translation.en: There goes Houston.
It's Weekend at Bernie's. It's just like, how can we get him to the finish line?
translation.ko: '베니의 주말' 영화처럼 어떻게든 끌고 가려 했어요

translation.en: The wheels are coming off. I'm talking to him every day.
translation.ko: 계속 문제가 터지고 조니에게 매일 얘기했어요

translation.en: "Stay accountable. You've worked your whole life. We got one month to go."
translation.ko: '책임감을 가져라 평생 노력했고 이제 한 달 남았다'

translation.en: People are talking first pick overall or a top ten.
The story that just sums up the whole thing,
the night before his private workout with the Browns…
[Erik] They all fly in.
They're gonna do dinner with him in College Station

Dinner goes awesome.
So we go up to our rooms…
[Billy] I miss about five calls from him.
I go over there, and it's a shit show.
Bottles of 1942 everywhere.
He's drinking straight outta the wine bottles.
So the next day, one of the receivers is missing.
This other receiver's drunk, can't get up.
So the Browns walk in the facility, he's warming up,
translation.ko: 브라운스가 왔을 때 조니는 워밍업을 하고 있었죠

translation.en: they look over, they're like, "Where's the receivers?"
translation.ko: 그 사람들이 리시버들은 어디 있는지 물으니

translation.en: And Johnny goes, "Ah, we're good."
You know who catches passes for him?
His lawyer,
his agent…
The first route, it's like, "Okay, let's run a slant." I'm like…
translation.ko: 첫 경로는 이런 식이에요 '우리 슬랜트로 가죠'

translation.en: Like I'm in high school, bros. This is ridiculous.
I call him, like, "How'd it go?"
He said, "I fucking killed it."
[broadcaster] Welcome indeed to New York City, to Radio City Music Hall
translation.ko: 뉴욕시 라디오 시티 뮤직홀에 잘 오셨습니다

translation.en: where, tonight, we find out where Johnny Manziel will be playing…
translation.ko: 오늘 밤 조니 맨젤의 향방이 이곳에서 결정될 예정이며…

translation.en: There's cameras in our face around our table the entire time.
From the minute we walk in, it's like the Johnny Manziel Show.
translation.ko: 입장하는 그 순간부터 조니 맨젤 쇼였어요

translation.en: "Where's he going?" And we have no idea.
With the first pick in the 2014 NFL draft,
the Houston Texans select Jadeveon Clowney.
[Erik] Then you had the Jacksonville Jaguars at three.
I had on good authority. They were ready to take a franchise quarterback.
translation.ko: 쿼터백을 뽑을 예정이라는 믿을 만한 정보가 있었어요

translation.en: The Jacksonville Jaguars select Blake Bortles.
[broadcaster] The first quarterback of this draft selected is not Johnny Manziel.
translation.ko: 이번 드래프트의 첫 쿼터백은 조니 맨젤이 아닙니다

translation.en: Bortles goes three, and Johnny's like, "Fuck, yes! I'm going to Dallas."
translation.ko: 보틀스가 세 번째로 가자 조니는 '됐어, 난 댈러스행이다' 했죠

translation.en: [broadcaster] What happens when Jerry Jones gets the chance to take Johnny Football?
translation.ko: 제리 존스가 조니 풋볼을 차지하면 어떻게 될까요?

translation.en: [Johnny] I really thought the floor would probably be Dallas at 16.
They wait the whole clock.
[broadcaster] If they take Johnny Manziel right now, this place is gonna explode.
translation.ko: 지금 조니 맨젤을 뽑으면 이곳은 터져나갈 겁니다

translation.en: The Dallas Cowboys select
Zack Martin, guard, Notre Dame.
We're sitting at the draft table, and he's just going down the draft.
translation.ko: 드래프트 테이블에 앉아 있는데 조니의 순위는 계속 내려갔죠

translation.en: A lot of teams did their homework.
[broadcaster] Snubbed by team after team after team after team.
translation.ko: 조니는 이 팀 저 팀에 차례로 퇴짜를 맞고 있습니다

translation.en: [Johnny] I was nervous about it. You can see it on my face on draft night.
translation.ko: 전 떨고 있었어요 그때 제 얼굴에 다 드러났을걸요

translation.en: I think you can see it in a lot of people around me.
Like, if I don't get picked in the first round, I'll probably disappear, run off the face of the earth.
And I remember being horrified. Like, my career's on the line right now too.
translation.ko: 겁에 질려 있었어요 제 앞날도 간당간당했고요

translation.en: So at that point, I'm, like, texting Cleveland, "Come back in, bro. Trust me."
translation.ko: 그래서 클리블랜드에 문자를 했죠 '다시 절 좀 믿어주세요'

translation.en: -Browns at 26 just moved up to 22. -[crowd] Johnny!
And you can hear the chant in the Radio City Music Hall for Johnny.
translation.ko: 라디오 시티 뮤직홀에 조니의 이름이 울려 퍼집니다

translation.en: [man laughing mockingly] Ha ha ha!
With the 22nd pick,
the Cleveland Browns select
Johnny Manziel,
quarterback, Texas A&M.
[broadcaster] My goodness.
[Erik] That moment was unbelievable.
[broadcaster] Right there, is the hope for the city of Cleveland.
[Erik] As down as it felt… It felt like we were in there for three days.
translation.ko: 잔뜩 처져 있다가… 사흘은 기다린 기분이었죠

translation.en: He walks across that stage, and does the Money Manziel.
[Erik] Holy shit.
He went in the first round.
It all works out.
[broadcaster] The Browns finally get the face of their franchise.
[Erik] I was like, "We're gonna make it."
"He's gonna be the savior. They're gonna build statues of this guy."
And then, I'll never forget, we leave the draft,
translation.ko: 절대 잊지 못할 게 있는데 드래프트 현장을 나와서

translation.en: we're at this light and the sunroof's open
translation.ko: 선루프를 연 채 신호 대기 중이었어요

translation.en: and Johnny's like, crushing shots of whatever in this limo with his family and friends,
translation.ko: 조니는 리무진에서 사람들과 부어라 마셔라 하고요

translation.en: and we look up
and it was the first Nike ad on the side of this building in New York,
translation.ko: 뉴욕의 한 건물 측면에 첫 나이키 광고가 보였어요

translation.en: and I was like, "Wow."
"Let's go."
[woman] Well, the news is Johnny Manziel is having a ripple effect across Browns Nation.
translation.ko: 조니 맨젤 소식으로 브라운스 팬 페이지가 들썩입니다

translation.en: -[people shouting] Johnny! -[man] Whoa!
[Johnny] You know, the people around me that I had, um, were genuinely very, very excited.
translation.ko: 그때 만난 사람들은 모두 진심으로 기대에 차 있었어요

translation.en: You know, they thought this was a great opportunity for me to come in
translation.ko: 큰 호재로 본 거죠, 제가 들어와서

translation.en: and to revitalize a franchise that had been struggling for a long time.
You know, every day that passes, every week that goes by is… is only a positive thing for me.
translation.ko: 저는 하루하루 한 주 한 주 더 좋아지고 있어요

translation.en: There was so much pressure on him and expectations,
and you could tell he was struggling.
[Johnny] Didn't take me very long to be in Cleveland
translation.ko: 클리블랜드에 온 지 얼마 안 돼서

translation.en: to find out that I wasn't gonna be happy there.
translation.ko: 제가 여기서 행복하지 못할 걸 알았어요

translation.en: I had every single thing that I could've ever wanted.
You have money, you have fame,
you're a first-round draft pick battling for a starting quarterback position,
translation.ko: 1차에서 지명받아 선발 쿼터백 자리를 놓고 싸우고

translation.en: and when I got everything that I wanted,
I think I was the most empty that I've ever felt inside.
translation.ko: 제 내면은 가장 공허했던 것 같아요

translation.en: [Johnny] You know, I'd always had a great time in the locker room with my guys
translation.ko: 전 라커룸에서 동료들과 어울리는 게 좋았어요

translation.en: and the practice and the camaraderie and everything that comes along with it,
translation.ko: 훈련이니 동료애니 하는 그 온갖 것들 있잖아요

translation.en: but I never felt that way in the NFL.
translation.ko: 하지만 NFL에서는 그걸 전혀 못 느꼈어요

translation.en: What it takes to be the face of franchise each and every day,
translation.ko: 매일 구단의 간판으로 살기란 조니가 할 수 있는 일이 아니었죠

translation.en: that's just not who he is, and he never put that much into it.
translation.ko: 매일 구단의 간판으로 살기란 조니가 할 수 있는 일이 아니었죠 딱히 노력도 안 했고요

translation.en: If he wanted to do it, his skill set and how good he is as a player,
he could've done it. He never worked at it.
[Erik] I started seeing signs pretty early on in Cleveland.
The one thing for me was he always loved the game,
translation.ko: 조니는 늘 시합을 좋아했는데 훈련 후에 전화해서

translation.en: and he'd call me after practice, like, "I don't… Man, it's not fun anymore."
translation.ko: 이젠 재미가 없다고 한 말이 제겐 결정적이었습니다

translation.en: Their GM's calling me going, "He doesn't watch tape."
translation.ko: 단장이 제게 그러더군요 '조니는 시합 영상을 안 봐요'

translation.en: I'm like, "Well, he's gotta watch some tape."
He's like, "EB, his iPad hours is 0.00."
Zero.
I would sit in my condo in Cleveland downtown
and just feel like it was the only place that I could get away from everybody and anything.
translation.ko: 그냥 거기 숨어 아무도 안 만나고 아무것도 안 하고 싶었어요

translation.en: And I would look out those windows every day and I just felt empty.
translation.ko: 텅 빈 기분으로 매일 창밖만 내다봤죠

translation.en: I went from one fishbowl city to another, and I wanted nothing to do with football.
translation.ko: 이 도시나 저 도시나 답답하고 풋볼은 지긋지긋했어요

translation.en: I wanted nothing to do with stepping on that field.
And I had bigger issues in my life
translation.ko: 그리고 제 인생에는 더 큰 문제가 있었어요

translation.en: than being able to go out and play free-spirited, flowing football.
translation.ko: 밖에 나가서 자유롭게 풋볼을 하는 것보다요

translation.en: I had gone from the whirlwind ride of 2012 in College Station,
the Heisman Trophy, the Cotton Bowl, the NCAA investigation,
translation.ko: 하이즈먼 트로피, 코튼 볼과 NCAA 조사를 거쳐

translation.en: straight into another season, into the NFL draft.
translation.ko: 곧장 새 시즌에 투입되고 다시 NFL 드래프트로 갔죠

translation.en: I just didn't get a break.
[Johnny] It's been life for so long now.
I can't really think back to the days of how it was

translation.ko: 어딜 가든 사람들이 트윗을 하고 사진을 찍지 않던 시절요

translation.en: [Johnny] I truly almost see those times in black and white.
translation.ko: 그 시절은 마치 흑백 사진처럼 떠올라요

translation.en: And I didn't know why I couldn't see sunny days.
translation.ko: 그리고 전 왜 제가 항상 우울한지 몰랐어요

translation.en: [commentator] …Manziel, and Manziel is buried.
And there's your first cash sign.
This thing of the, you know, show me the money.
Every time they sack him, the defensemen do that right in his face.
translation.ko: 태클을 당할 때마다 수비수가 면전에서 그걸 해요

translation.en: He had a terrible start in the NFL.
[presenter] It was horrific…
[presenter 1] Nothing like the Johnny Football we saw at Texas A&M.
translation.ko: 텍사스 A&M에서 보던 조니 풋볼이 아닙니다

translation.en: I'm supposed to be the savior. [inhales] You know, I'm just looking for a good day.
translation.ko: 전 구세주여야 했어요 좋은 날이 오기만 기다렸죠

translation.en: In the back of my head all the time,
I was telling myself, "You do not wanna fuckin' be here."
translation.ko: 자신에게 말했죠 '난 여기 있기 싫어, 젠장'

translation.en: And "Do what you need to do to get out."
[presenter] Stories surfaced about him being late for team meetings.
translation.ko: 조니가 팀 회의에 지각이 잦다고 합니다

translation.en: He was demoted to third-string quarterback.
A high-price, first-round draft pick heading in the wrong direction.
translation.ko: 거액의 1차 드래프트 선발 선수가 엉뚱한 방향으로 가고 있네요

translation.en: Yeah, I…
You know, I made the decision to go out on Friday night.
translation.ko: 금요일 밤이라 바람 좀 쐬려고 했어요

translation.en: I think I was trying to suppress how I felt,
and get out of being Johnny Football.
When he turned pro, the partying became more public.
translation.ko: 프로가 된 후로 파티는 더 거침없어졌습니다

translation.en: -I can't hear. -He can't hear you.
There's too much money… in my… hand.
Nothing that I'm doing on the weekends is affecting my job.
translation.ko: 주말에 뭘 하든 일에는 지장 없어요

translation.en: Nothing on the weekends that I'm doing, um, is hopefully hurting any of my teammates in my locker room.
translation.ko: 제가 주말에 뭘 하든 팀 동료들에겐 피해 없을 거예요

translation.en: [Paul] So he kinda just said, "Fuck it. I just got $8.5 million,
translation.ko: 그러니까 그냥 '닥쳐'라고 한 거죠 '난 방금 850만 달러를 벌었으니'

translation.en: so I'll just go do what I want."
People around me always told me, like, "You're doing this on purpose."
translation.ko: 주위 사람들이 늘 이랬죠 '너 일부러 이러는 거지?'

translation.en: Now, in my conscious mind, that didn't make sense to me.
He just keeps putting himself in situations where he's getting himself in trouble.
translation.ko: 문제가 생길 만한 곳만 찾아다니고 있어요

translation.en: That guy knows that he represents more than himself
translation.ko: 본인이 일개 개인이 아니란 걸 아는 친구고

translation.en: and has issues off the field.
It's… It is frustrating.
I wanted to get him help. We all knew he was self-destructing.
translation.ko: 도움을 받게 하고 싶었어요 그 애가 자멸하는 게 보였죠

translation.en: [Erik] It was like he stopped caring.
And I was like, "Okay, we gotta do rehab."
[female presenter] Johnny Football, the big bust of a rookie last year,
translation.ko: 작년 신입 선수로 대실패한 조니 풋볼은

translation.en: entered a treatment program on Wednesday.
It was hard the first couple days,
obviously being a guy that's on every single TV.
translation.ko: TV만 틀면 제가 나왔으니 아무래도 그렇죠

translation.en: He's been somewhat of a legend, and perhaps to his own peril here.
[Johnny] I did have people trying to figure out which treatment center I was at,
translation.ko: 제가 어느 치료 센터에 갔는지 다들 알아내려 했어요

translation.en: and I remember walking down the hill one day
and seeing this rental car drive right past us,
and it was Jeremy Fowler from ESPN, and I just…
It threw me for a loop whenever that happened.
[female presenter] When he returned to the team after ten weeks of rehab,
he looked and sounded like a changed man.
translation.ko: 조니는 외양도 언행도 전혀 달라 보였습니다

translation.en: I'm gonna say "Loser in life." Can't get out of it.
The hype and everything is a little bit tempered and a little down,
translation.ko: 제게 집중된 온갖 관심이 좀 누그러들고 식어서

translation.en: and that, for me, is a good thing.
Got out of rehab. He was doing awesome. He was focused.
He started playing, and you could just gradually see,
translation.ko: 하지만 다시 경기에 출전하고 다른 영향들을 접하면서

translation.en: once he started being around other influences, here we go again.
translation.ko: 예전으로 돌아가는 모습이 점점 눈에 보였어요

translation.en: When you take one step onto a slippery slope,
you know, it goes pretty quick.
Remember, he went to rehab, not supposed to drink.
Drank, got into a fight with his girlfriend.
[broadcaster] Both Manziel and the woman told police they had been drinking.
translation.ko: 맨젤과 여성은 둘 다 경찰에 술을 마셨다고 했습니다

translation.en: No charges were filed.
And after that, it started to spiral a little bit more and more and more.
translation.ko: 그 후로 점점 더 꼬이기 시작했어요

translation.en: I thought I would go to Vegas on a Saturday afternoon
translation.ko: "네바다주 라스베이거스 2016년 1월 2일" 토요일 오후에 라스베이거스에 가기로 했어요

translation.en: and I would turn around and come back and be in time for the game the next day.
[presenter] It sounded a little cuckoo,
but he had the wig on, there was a fake mustache involved.
[Johnny] I sit down at a blackjack table,
and I can start to see people, you know, looking at me a little bit.
This is when the Twitter shitstorm absolutely hits the fan.
translation.ko: 트위터가 발칵 뒤집힌 게 바로 그때였어요

translation.en: I don't know anything about getting a plane to leave Vegas
to go back to Cleveland. I'm looking at commercial flights.
translation.ko: 어떻게 구할지 몰라서 일반 항공편을 찾아봤어요

translation.en: I missed the last one at 10:30, and at this point, I'm like,
"Well, let's fucking rip it tonight."
I completely detached from all of it.
Johnny Football is now looking for another team this morning.
translation.ko: 조니 풋볼이 다른 팀을 물색 중입니다

translation.en: The Cleveland Browns cutting ties with Johnny Manziel and his bad-boy behavior.
translation.ko: 클리블랜드 브라운스가 악동 조니 맨젤을 방출했습니다

translation.en: [presenter] There is no future for Johnny Manziel with the Cleveland Browns,
certainly not anymore, as the Browns have finally realized.
translation.ko: 이제는 끝이라는 걸 브라운스가 드디어 깨달았죠

translation.en: Manziel is not reachable.
[Paul] It was just…
It was disastrous. It was… It was the fall.
[presenter] One of the biggest busts in NFL history.
"Tiny," "selfish," "undisciplined," "immature," "sort of a brat."
[presenter 1] Johnny Manziel arrived as the future of Cleveland football,
translation.ko: 클리블랜드 풋볼의 미래를 안고 온 조니 맨젤이

translation.en: and now he will soon leave as an embarrassment.
[Johnny] When I got cut from the Browns,
I felt like the biggest weight lifted off my shoulders ever.
But that didn't translate into what I experienced
and what I… [inhales deeply] …would deal with in my everyday life.
[news reporter] Dallas police say they are examining hotel surveillance video
translation.ko: 댈러스 경찰이 호텔 CCTV를 확인 중입니다

translation.en: showing an encounter between Manziel and his ex-girlfriend, Colleen Crowley.
translation.ko: 맨젤과 전 여자친구 콜린 크롤리의 다툼 때문이라고 합니다

translation.en: Crowley said Manziel led her down a back stairway,
translation.ko: 맨젤의 손에 건물 뒤쪽 계단으로 끌려가던 크롤리가

translation.en: and that she told the valet,
"Please don't let him take me. I'm scared for my life."
translation.ko: '제발 이 사람을 막아줘요 절 죽일지도 몰라요'

translation.en: [Johnny] Throughout that relationship, I was unfaithful
translation.ko: 사귀는 동안 전 줄곧 바람을 피웠어요

translation.en: and, you know, we get into a heated, heated argument.
You know, she's trying to jump out of the car, and, um…
Colleen Crowley has obtained a protective order from a judge in Texas
translation.ko: 텍사스주 법원에서 접근 금지 명령을 내렸습니다

translation.en: that will keep Johnny Manziel away from her for two years.
It was so out of control,
but he couldn't hear it.
His mind was so gone. I mean, he was just…
Did you apologize for what happened?
What about rehab, Johnny? Gonna go to rehab?
We tried to get him in another rehab.
Took him, you… you know.
He escapes.
[man] Friends and family are concerned. Everything going well?
translation.ko: 친구와 가족들이 걱정이 많은데 별일 없나요?

translation.en: My friends and family are all right. They're with me.
translation.ko: 친구와 가족들은 잘 있어요 다들 제 편이에요

translation.en: [Paul] My relationship with Johnny was very strained.
"I've done everything I can for ya. You're not listening."
translation.ko: '난 널 위해 최선을 다했는데 넌 내 말을 듣지도 않아'

translation.en: "You're self-destructing. You're disrespectful."
translation.ko: '넌 자신을 망치고 있어 이 건방진 녀석'

translation.en: Pretty much "Go fuck yourself. Go… You know more than I do, so go ahead."
translation.ko: 그럼 엿이나 먹으란 식이에요 '그렇게 잘 알면 직접 하시죠'

translation.en: [female presenter] His dad says Manziel refused rehab twice in the past week.
translation.ko: 부친에 따르면 맨젤은 지난주 두 차례나 치료를 거부했습니다

translation.en: I said, "If you miss one counseling session, I will have to literally terminate you,"
translation.ko: 상담을 한 번만 빼먹어도 우리 계약은 파기라고 했어요

translation.en: which doesn't happen in agent business, much less to Johnny Football.
translation.ko: 에이전트 업계에선 말도 안 되죠 하물며 조니 풋볼인데

translation.en: [female presenter] Even his agent, Erik Burkhardt, is dumping Manziel.
[Johnny] I got released as a client of my uncle, who was doing my attorney work.
translation.ko: 제 법률 업무를 맡고 있던 삼촌도 저와의 관계를 끊으셨어요

translation.en: My dad withdrew his name from my company,
and the people around me, closest to me,
were in the mindset of, "We have to let him go."
And, you know, when that happened,
it was full-blown "I'm gonna rub this whole thing in your fucking face."
"You think you've seen something now? You haven't seen shit yet."
translation.ko: '볼 만큼 본 것 같아? 아직 한참 멀었어'

translation.en: [Johnny] You know, the first point in my life where I really ramped up my drug use
translation.ko: 약물 복용량을 올릴 대로 올려서 매일 하기 시작한 건

translation.en: to a constant, daily thing.
-[man] Johnny, got anything you wanna say? -[man 1] Johnny Football. How's it going?
[Johnny] I was mostly doing a lot of coke and taking Oxys.
translation.ko: 주로 코카인을 잔뜩 하고 옥시코틴도 했죠

translation.en: I went from 215 pounds in January to 175 pounds by September.
The wires in my head seemed very twisted.
I got diagnosed as bipolar,
and I felt like it was the same as being called an alcoholic or a drug addict.
[presenter] The money and the fame and the criticism and the social media
it is eating him alive.
[Johnny] I think I was just running from problems.
Probably a f… five-million-dollar bender.
translation.ko: 그때 아마 500만 달러짜리 술 파티였을 거예요

translation.en: [Johnny] Direct self-sabotage, trying to burn this thing down.
translation.ko: 자기 파괴 행위죠 아예 다 태워버리는 거예요

translation.en: I had planned to do everything that I wanted to do
translation.ko: 그때는 하고 싶은 걸 몽땅 할 계획이었어요

translation.en: at that point in my life.
Spend as much money as I possibly could, and then my plan was to take my life.
translation.ko: 최대한 많은 돈을 쓰고 죽어버리는 게 계획이었습니다

translation.en: [Johnny] You know, I… Months prior, went and bought a gun
translation.ko: 그 몇 달 전에 총을 샀는데

translation.en: that I knew I was gonna use.
[Johnny] I wanted it to get as bad as humanly possible to where it made sense,
translation.ko: 인간적으로 가능한 최악의 지경까지 가려고 했어요

translation.en: and it made it seem like an excuse and an out for me.
translation.ko: 그게 저한테는 핑계이자 출구가 돼줄 테니까요

translation.en: Still, to this day, I don't know what happened,
but the gun just clicked on me.
I couldn't fix what I'd done
translation.ko: 제가 한 짓은 되돌릴 수 없었죠

translation.en: with Colleen, with the NFL, with A&M, everything.
translation.ko: 콜린에게, NFL에, A&M에 했던 그 모든 일들요

translation.en: You know, at that point in time, I didn't have much of a relationship with my family.
The ride was over.
[Johnny] I left LA not knowing where I was gonna go, um,
not knowing what was gonna happen, and I went back to Texas,
and, you know, I didn't really say a whole lot to my dad,
just kinda showed up at the front door
and pretty much saying, "I don't have anywhere else to turn, man."
-[birds chirping] -[Johnny whistles] Come on.
[breathes in] Come here.
-Come here. -[Paul chuckles]
I took him yesterday and he was runnin', runnin' wild on the golf course.
-I'll send you a video. -You should take him every day.
He doesn't wanna stay in the house, I know that.
[Paul] It's been a long, long road, and it's been…
I don't know if it's been great
or if it's been bad.
That's kinda still up for debate.
[Paul] Come up the hill.
[Johnny] All right. I'll drive down the first one.
[Paul] But we're blessed, and he's still with us.
translation.ko: 하지만 우린 축복받았어요 조니도 우리 곁에 있고요

translation.en: [grunts softly] Yeah.
[Paul] And we can mend all the fences still.
[Johnny] Hey, you hit one good out of three.
translation.ko: 세 번에 한 번은 제대로 쳤네요

translation.en: But I think Johnny's got a lot better days coming
translation.ko: 하지만 조니에겐 훨씬 좋은 날들이 올 거예요

translation.en: than what he's had.
[Meri] A lot of people wonder, you know, why isn't he doing anything?
translation.ko: 왜 집에만 있는지 궁금해하는 사람이 많아요

translation.en: He's not in a place mentally
to go out and do something right now.
I know how much good he can do in this world,
translation.ko: 세상에 줄 게 아주 많은 사람이지만

translation.en: but I know the struggle he goes through every single day of his life.
And it's never gonna go away.
[Johnny] I think people do maybe worry about me sometimes,
translation.ko: 가끔 절 걱정하는 말들이 있기는 하지만

translation.en: but, I mean, that… that's natural.
You know, I've given them reason to do that.
I didn't go into Texas A&M thinking I was gonna play two years
translation.ko: 텍사스 A&M에 들어갔을 땐 겨우 2년 뛰고

translation.en: and end up in the NFL draft.
translation.ko: NFL 드래프트에 가게 될 줄 몰랐어요

translation.en: You know, I thought if I ever got to play football in college,
that would be an unbelievable accomplishment for me.
And I tell people all the time, it wouldn't have mattered where I was at, um, what team.
translation.ko: 저는 항상 어느 팀에 갔든 똑같았을 거라고 해요

translation.en: Wherever it was, at that point in time in my life,
I was incapable of being a good NFL quarterback.
translation.ko: 전 좋은 NFL 쿼터백이 될 수 없었어요

translation.en: [Johnny] You know, when you get to that point, you're supposed to fuckin' know better.
translation.ko: 그 지점에 도달하면 정신을 좀 차려야죠

translation.en: Supposed to know what to do, behave like a pro.
translation.ko: 뭘 해야 하는지 알고 프로답게 행동해야 해요

translation.en: You're supposed to push your career forward,
your athleticism forward, you know, your strive for being a great athlete.
[Johnny] But when it came down to it, you know, I was a frat boy,
and it's just my frat was the football team.
I loved what I did. I loved the freedom.
translation.ko: 전 제 일을 사랑했어요 자유를 사랑했죠

translation.en: I loved being the guy
that got to go do all these amazing things on and off the field.
translation.ko: 멋진 일을 할 수 있어서 좋았어요

translation.en: You know, but at some point in time, you have to look back
and think, "Fuck, was enough ever enough?"
translation.ko: 이런 생각이 들죠 '젠장, 적당히 할 수 없었나?'

translation.en: You know, are you ever gonna be satisfied,
or you're just gonna continue living that frat-boy life
for year after year after year
until you finally look up, and you're still living it,
and it's been detrimental to where you wanted to go in life
translation.ko: '그 때문에 네가 원한 삶과 하고 싶었던 일이'

translation.en: and what you wanted to do.
You know, it's hard for me to sit back and look at these days.
translation.ko: 요즘은 가만히 앉아 과거를 돌아보기가 힘들어요

translation.en: It feels like a distant memory for the most part.
But, you know, I'm very much on the pursuit of happiness
in a way more simplistic form than I was years ago.
I don't really see myself as the… as the Johnny-Football-craze
translation.ko: 다들 조니 풋볼에 열광하지만 그건 진짜 제가 아니에요

translation.en: that's kinda… thatt's kinda swept Aggielands. That swept around the nation a little bit.
translation.ko: 우리 학교가 온통 들썩이고 전국이 들썩였지만요

translation.en: Um, I see myself as Johnny Manziel.
I'm a guy from Kerrville, Texas, who just tried to be a laid-back guy
translation.ko: 텍사스주 커빌 출신의 느긋하게 살고 싶고

translation.en: who likes to hang out with my friends
and be a normal college student just like anybody else.
translation.ko: 남들처럼 평범한 대학생으로 살고 싶은 남자죠
